content.question: A student holds onto a roll of paper, as shown in the figure. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the student drops the roll while still holding onto the end of the paper, allowing the paper to unroll as it falls. At <math alttext="t equals t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the unrolled strip of paper rips, allowing the remaining roll of paper to fall freely. Which of the following graphs best describes the angular velocity of the roll as a function of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> ? Assume that the mass of the paper unrolls during the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> does not significantly change the mass of the remaining roll of paper.

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in a plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated halfway along the axis. The vertical axis is labeled omega. The first line segment begins at the origin, and it moves upward and to the right until it reaches about a quarter of the way up the vertical axis above t sub 1. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and it moves downward and to the right and ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in a plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated halfway along the axis. The vertical axis is labeled omega. The first line segment begins at the origin, and it moves upward and to the right until it reaches about a quarter of the way up the vertical axis above t sub 1. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and it moves to the right horizontally and ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of a line segment in a plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated halfway along the axis. The vertical axis is labeled omega. The line segment begins at the origin, and it moves upward and to the right and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of two line segments in a plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated halfway along the axis. The vertical axis is labeled omega. The first line segment begins at the origin, and it moves upward and to the right until it reaches about a quarter of the way up the vertical axis above t sub 1. The second line segment begins where the first one ends, and it moves upward and to the right more steeply than the first line segment and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in a plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated halfway along the axis. The vertical axis is labeled omega. The first line segment begins at the origin, and it moves upward and to the right until it reaches about a quarter of the way up the vertical axis above t sub 1. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and it moves to the right horizontally and ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
